intro: Pachycentria walkeri, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water. Pachycentria walkeri is also known for its milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested.
